title: Ticket #6993: Request new function to add labels to GCE universe VM in the submit fi
description:
Fermilab uses the "Labels" function in our Google Cloud Engine virtual machines to distinguish which server requested them and on behalf of which VO. To do this it is possible to append a "labels" section to the json file.

"labels": { "detype": "hepcsvc03", "vo": "fermilab" }

Since our json file is in a glideinwms factory, and some of these variables change dynamically, we would like the option to add a label at submit time, independent of the rest of the json file.

A structure similar to the ec2_tag structure for the AWS EC2 type would be very helpful and useful. GCE labels work about the same as AWS tags do.
remarks:
2019-Jun-20 13:53:21 by tlmiller:
For now, the cloud_label_ stuff assumes GCE; it is therefore parallel to but ignored by the EC2 gahp (and vice-versa) because of different requirements on the attribute names and values. These are only currently checked in the GAHP, but they could be checked earlier if anyone ever ends up caring.

Needs documentation:

  • release note
  • job ad attributes
  • in condor_submit manpage
